revised_title: The Croonian Lecture: On the Coagulation of Blood and Formation of Muscular Fibers
tldr: This article discusses the changes blood undergoes during coagulation and the role of blood globules in the formation of muscular fibers. The author presents observations made using a microscope, suggesting that blood globules may be the building blocks of muscular fibers. The study also mentions the potential role of attraction between globules in the coagulation process.
